content:
Hello @WG-unsafe-code-guidelines -- so it's confirmed that this coming Thursday, March 14, we'll be the first "test case" for the new lang team / working-group sync meetings. I've got a draft announcement here, which currently reads:

# Unsafe code guidelines working group sync

The first lang-team working group sync will be taking place this coming Thursday, March 14. The meeting concerns the Unsafe Code Guidelines working group. We will be presenting this write-up of the current status and plans. The goal of the meeting is both to inform the lang-team and broader community about what we've been up to, and to gather feedback on the overall direction -- not so much to debate technical minutia, though that too could happen. =)

This is an open meeting. It will be held over Zoom and will be recorded and posted to YouTube after the fact.

I hope that you all can make it!
Also, please feel free to open PRs against my write-up if you see any problems with it (among other things, it's kind of incomplete, so I'd love help in updating the current status).
i'll tweet it out once it's announced!
cool, I was going to put this into internals and do the same, I guess?
@avadacatavra posted here
I'm excited about this =)

i'll tweet it out once it's announced!

you tweet too! :)
TOO MANY TWITTER TABS
@nikomatsakis is there a web view for the calendar?
I am trying to figure out the time for the meeting ;)
@RalfJ yes, try this
someone mentioned to me that I put the wrong link in the web page
I will fix it now
great, thanks!
so it says "3pm" but doesn't tell me which timezone...?
ah, 3pm eastern but it only says that when you click on "more information". and of course it doesn't tell you the UTC offset of eastern. sigh
yeah, bottom left of the calendar but no offset "Events shown in time zone: Eastern Time - New York"
is it UTC-4 or UTC-5? not sure when DST is starting over there
US DST starts tomorrow, 10 Mar
ah so it's again those two weeks where the offset to European timezones is different
It's three weeks :(
what time is this in UTC ?
we need a time-zones bot
it's 20:00 German time (UTC+1)
I think^^
so 19:00 UTC. would have been helpful to put that somewhere in the announcements, in particular considering that it happens during the time when the US is shifted by 1 compared to Europe
I won't make it because of captain marvel
this is a very good reason
I'll try to get the book rendering before the meeting online, so that people can easily take a look at it

so 19:00 UTC. would have been helpful to put that somewhere in the announcements, in particular considering that it happens during the time when the US is shifted by 1 compared to Europe

Good point, I will edit the announcement.
